results.title: A Shame like Alice. Parts. 1 & 2
results.creator_credit: Leonard Lee, SBS-TV and Lee Gordon Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Focus”.
The plight of Australia’s Aborigines around Alice Springs. Are Aborigines being treated in accordance with the United Nations Charter which states all human beings should be free and equal? Includes interviews with Neville Bonner and Al Grassby
results.creator_credit_for_label: Leonard Lee, SBS-TV and Lee Gordon Productions

results.title: Love by arrangement (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Gordon Bick and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Focus”.
Looks at traditional arranged marriages carried out in Australia by various migrant groups. Presents interviews with members of the Muslim and English communities, discussing their views on arranged marriage and the selection of prospective partners.

results.title: A Matter of communication (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Leonard Lee and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Focus”.
FOCUS looks at the difficulties experienced by many migrants in understanding the Anglo-Saxon legal system and investigates the way people are treated at the hands of the law. A Vietnamese man in condemned for killing a dog for consumption and a Lebanese man allegedly is bashed by police.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Leonard Lee and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service

results.title: Two Different Worlds (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Focus”.
A story of children challenging the attitudes of their migrant parents and growing apart from their discipline and culture. The repercussions of holding two standards - that of their parents and that of the new Australian society. How do they cope with two values.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Focus”.

results.title: Third class third rate (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Leonard Lee and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Focus”.
FOCUS investigates the claim that some women in Australia are treated as third class citizens by their husbands. It tells of the life of a migrant woman who made the transition from old world values to modern day society.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Leonard Lee and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service

results.title: The Kamikaze of industry (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Leonard Lee and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Focus”.
A study of Workers’ Compensation. Some migrant workers have been described as the ‘kamikaze of industry’. They have also been accused of being compo-cheats. Is the label justified?

results.title: Just who's prejudiced? (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Leonard Lee and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Focus”.
A look at the claim that some migrant Australians will not associate with Anglo-Saxon Australians because they lack ‘culture’. Is there such a thing as an ‘Ocker Aussie?’
